sentence.Network_en: The two men managed to elude the police for six weeks.
sentence.Network_cn: 这两个男人想方设法逃避警方追捕达六个星期。

sentence.Network_en: I had dared and baffled his fury; I must elude his sorrow.
sentence.Network_cn: 我曾经面对过他的愤怒,并且把它挫败了; 现在我必须躲避他的悲哀.

sentence.Network_en: The thief eluded the police; This difficult idea seems to elude me.
sentence.Network_cn: 小偷躲避了警察; 这个难题看起来躲避了我.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'delude, baffle'): from Latin eludere, from e- (variant of ex-) 'out, away from' + ludere 'to play'

entry.def: If something that you want eludes you, you fail to obtain it.

example.ex: At 62, Brian found the celebrity and status that had eluded him for so long.
example.tran: 布赖恩在62岁时获得了多年来未能得到的名望和地位。

entry.def: If you elude someone or something, you avoid them or escape from them.

example.ex: He eluded the police for 13 years.
example.tran: 他躲过了警方抓捕达13年。

entry.tran: 不为…所明白;不为…所记得
entry.def: If a fact or idea eludes you, you do not succeed in understanding it, realizing it, or remembering it.

sentences.sentence: "This difficult idea seems to evade her"

means.word_mean: 2. be incomprehensible to; escape understanding by;

sentences.sentence: "What you are seeing in him eludes me"

means.word_mean: 3. avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues);

auth_sentence.content: But knowing when to stop seems to elude Barnes.
auth_sentence.res_content: But knowing when to stop seems to elude Barnes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But knowing when to stop seems to elude Barnes.

auth_sentence.content: Praxis would elude her escort...and slip off home.
auth_sentence.res_content: Praxis would elude her escort...and slip off home.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Praxis would elude her escort...and slip off home.

auth_sentence.content: But one particle continues to elude scientists -- the Higgs Boson.
auth_sentence.res_content: But one particle continues to elude scientists -- the Higgs Boson.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But one particle continues to elude scientists -- the Higgs Boson.

means.word_mean: (尤指机敏地)避开; 逃避; 躲避

sentences.en: His name eludes me for the moment.
sentences.cn: 他的名字我一时想不起来了。

sentences.en: The two men managed to elude the police for six weeks.
sentences.cn: 这两个男人想方设法逃避警方追捕达六个星期.

means.word_mean: 使达不到; 使不记得; 使不理解

sentences.en: He was extremely tired but sleep eluded him.
They 're a popular band but chart success has eluded them so far.
sentences.cn: 他们是一支很受欢迎的乐队，但到目前为止还未能登上每周流行唱片榜。

sentences.en: Finally he remembered the tiny detail that had eluded him the night before.
sentences.cn: 他终于想起了前一天晚上想不起来的细节。
